description.plain:
Abubakar Shariff-Farr (b. February 12, 1994), better known as Bakar, is a British artist and model from Camden Town, London. He is known for his unique experimental indie rock style and lists Skepta, Lily Allen, and Kele as some of his key inspirations.

After dropping a handful of tracks on SoundCloud in 2016, Bakar finally released his “official” debut single in 2017—“Big Dreams”—which was also the lead single from his first full-length project Badkid, released in May 2018.

In summer 2019, Bakar released his widely popular song “Hell N Back,” and not long after, shared his second project in the form of a six-track extended play entitled Will You Be My Yellow?, which featured a guest appearance from Dominic Fike.

In late 2020, Bakar shared three new singles in a short span of time: “1st Time,” “Play” with Lancey Foux, and lastly “Having a Good Time, Sometimes.”

body.plain:
Abubakar Shariff-Farr (b. February 12, 1994), better known as Bakar, is a British artist and model from Camden Town, London. He is known for his unique experimental indie rock style and lists Skepta, Lily Allen, and Kele as some of his key inspirations.

After dropping a handful of tracks on SoundCloud in 2016, Bakar finally released his “official” debut single in 2017—“Big Dreams”—which was also the lead single from his first full-length project Badkid, released in May 2018.

In summer 2019, Bakar released his widely popular song “Hell N Back,” and not long after, shared his second project in the form of a six-track extended play entitled Will You Be My Yellow?, which featured a guest appearance from Dominic Fike.

In late 2020, Bakar shared three new singles in a short span of time: “1st Time,” “Play” with Lancey Foux, and lastly “Having a Good Time, Sometimes.”

songs.title: Hell N Back

description.plain:
“Hell N Back” is the lead single from Will You Be My Yellow?. On the track, Bakar reminisces of the memorable and fun moments he’s had with his significant other. Especially, the time when he first met her.

Bakar announced the song only a few hours before its release on Twitter with a short preview of the song. It was later premiered on episode 7 of model Kendall Jenner’s Beats 1 radio show, ZAZA WORLD.

songs.embed_content: Read “Hell N Back” by Bakar on Genius

songs.lyrics:
32 ContributorsHell N Back Lyrics[Chorus]
Could you tell where my head was at when you found me?
Me and you went to hell and back just to find peace
Man, I thought I had everything, I was lonely
Now you're my everything, I was lonely

[Verse 1]
I mixed a lot of love with a lot of drugs, then I found you
She liked petty crimes, she had green eyes like Mountain Dew
And where she go, I'll never know, her friends bounced too
I guess it's their loss 'cause they'll never know what we'll amount to
Would you be my light, be my yellow?
P.Y.T. walking down Portobello
Put a smile on this face at the end of the day
MDMA helped us fly away
Who'd have known, who'd have known you would save my life?
Who'd have known, who'd have known you would fly my kite?
Could you tell, could you tell?
Could you tell, could you tell?
[Chorus]
Could you tell where my head was at when you found me?
Me and you went to hell and back just to find peace
Man, I thought I had everything, I was lonely
Now you're my everything, I was lonely

[Post-Chorus]
Yeah-eah-eah-eah
Yeah-eah-eah-eah
Yeah-eah-eah-eah, yeah
Yeah-eah-eah-eah

[Verse 2]
I remember, I remember, I was all alone
Late night you would call my phone
Just to check if I was blessed 'cause you knew I was low
Head gone, rollin' off the throne
I remember, I remember, we was in the park
Late night, made love on the grass
Got my head in the clouds, countin' all my stars
In my ears, said the world was ours
Went to hell and back just to heal my wounds
'Cause it gets like that, wrong side of the moon
No Tutankhamun, you're my Cleopatra
No side thing, don't need a backup
Need a real one, don't need an actor
I lost once they think you won a BAFTA
Come and be my girl, yeah
You might also like[Chorus]
Could you tell where my head was at when you found me?
Me and you went to hell and back just to find peace
Man, I thought I had everything, I was lonely
Now you're my everything, I was lonely

[Outro]
Yeah-eah-eah-eah (Just like we say)
Yeah-eah-eah-eah (Just like we say)
Yeah-eah-eah-eah, yeah (Just like we say)

songs.full_title: Stop Selling Her Drugs by Bakar (Ft. Dominic Fike)
songs.title: Stop Selling Her Drugs
songs.title_with_featured: Stop Selling Her Drugs (Ft. Dominic Fike)

description.plain:
Stop Selling Her Drugs discusses the aftermath of a relationship between a drug dealer and his girlfriend who is presumably addicted to the drugs he sells.
This is Bakar’s first collaborative song. In a press release, he described his creative process with Dominic Fike.

Me and Dom spent time whilst I was in America, and the connection was there right away just on a human level. We worked on a couple things at his house and when I got back to London ‘Stop Selling’ was the first thing I sent him. He bodied it.

The track is produced by Zach Nahome, who also produced most of Bakar’s debut album. Badkid.

I was always into you, you was meant to have my yute, girl

[Chorus: Bakar]
Open eye like I really wanna see more (Yeah)
Up and down every night like a see-saw (Yeah)
Tellin' lies like I really wanna be yours (Yeah)

Yeah, I think she likes me

songs.title: Big Dreams

description.plain:
“Big Dreams,” initially released as a single, was later added as the eleventh track on Bakar’s 2018 debut album, Badkid.

As the title suggests, in the song, Bakar talks about people who have big dreams, and to not put those people down for what they want to be regardless of their circumstances.

Bakar announced “Big Dreams” a week before it’s release via Twitter. Along with the release of “Big Dreams,” a music video was released on Bakar’s YouTube channel.

The song was featured on the soundtrack for EA Sports FIFA 19.

songs.embed_content: Read “Big Dreams” by Bakar on Genius
